members.doc: Day, month, year date input control.

members.name: radioButton
members.doc: Single-choice radio button style input control.

members.name: labels
members.doc: Additional guests control labels for each input.

members.name: namesMandatory
members.doc: Whether individual guest names are required.

members.name: addressLine
members.doc: Main address line (usually street and number) as free text

members.name: addressLine1
members.doc: Main address line (usually street and number) as free text

members.name: addressLine2
members.doc: Free text providing more detailed address info. Usually contains Apt, Suite, Floor

members.name: formatted
members.doc: A string containing the human-readable address of this location

members.name: streetAddress
members.doc: a break down of the street to number and street name

members.name: subdivision
members.doc: subdivision (usually state or region) code according to ISO 3166-2

members.name: full
members.doc: Whether address is multi-line (consisting of multiple fields such as country, city, postal code). When false, address is single-line.

members.name: labels
members.doc: Address control labels for each input.

members.name: addressLine
members.doc: Main address line (usually street and number) as free text

members.name: streetAddress
members.doc: a break down of the street to number and street name

members.name: enabled
members.doc: Whether the schedule is enabled for the event.

members.name: counts
members.doc: Assigned and assigned draft event counts.

members.name: states
members.doc:
Category state. Default - MANUAL.
WIX_EVENTS.MANAGE_AUTO_CATEGORIES permission is required to use other states.
Field will be ignored on update requests.

members.name: assignedEventsCount
members.doc: Assigned events count. Deleted events are excluded.

members.name: mandatory
members.doc: Whether at least one checkbox is required.

members.name: options
members.doc: Predefined options guests can choose from.

members.name: ticketingSummary
members.doc:
Summary of revenue and tickets sold.
(Archived orders are not included).

members.name: eventId
members.doc: Event ID to which the form belongs.

members.name: eventId
members.doc: Event ID to which the form belongs.

members.name: eventId
members.doc: Event ID to which the form belongs.

members.name: _id
members.doc:
Unique event ID.
Allows clients to ignore duplicate webhooks.

members.name: entityEventSequence
members.doc:
A sequence number defining the order of updates to the underlying entity.
For example, given that some entity was updated at 16:00 and than again at 16:01,
it is guaranteed that the sequence number of the second update is strictly higher than the first.
As the consumer, you can use this value to ensure that you handle messages in the correct order.
To do so, you will need to persist this number on your end, and compare the sequence number from the
message against the one you have stored. Given that the stored number is higher, you should ignore the message.

members.name: entityFqdn
members.doc:
Assumes actions are also always typed to an entity_type
Example: wix.stores.catalog.product, wix.bookings.session, wix.payments.transaction

members.name: entityId
members.doc: ID of the entity associated with the event.

members.name: originatedFrom
members.doc: If present, indicates the action that triggered the event.

members.name: slug
members.doc:
This is top level to ease client code dispatching of messages (switch on entity_fqdn+slug)
This is although the created/updated/deleted notion is duplication of the oneof types
Example: created/updated/deleted/started/completed/email_opened

members.name: triggeredByAnonymizeRequest
members.doc:
Whether the event was triggered as a result of a privacy regulation application
(for example, GDPR).

members.name: options
members.doc: Predefined options guests can choose from.

members.name: currentEntityAsJson
members.doc:
Since platformized APIs only expose PATCH and not PUT we can't assume that the fields sent from the client are the actual diff.
This means that to generate a list of changed fields (as opposed to sent fields) one needs to traverse both objects.
We don't want to impose this on all developers and so we leave this traversal to the notification recipients which need it.

members.name: about
members.doc: Rich-text content displayed in Wix UI - "About Event" section (HTML).

members.name: categories
members.doc: Categories this event is assigned to.

members.name: dashboard
members.doc: Event dashboard summary of RSVP / ticket sales.

members.name: feed
members.doc: Event discussion feed. For internal use.

members.name: instanceId
members.doc: Instance ID of the site where event is hosted.

members.name: language
members.doc: ISO 639-1 language code of the event (used in content translations).

members.name: slug
members.doc: Event slug URL (generated from event title).

members.name: hideEventDetailsButton
members.doc: Whether event details button is hidden. Only available for events with no registration.

members.name: timestamp
members.doc: Event update timestamp in ISO UTC format.

members.name: controls
members.doc: Nested fields as an ordered list.

description:
The form defines which elements are rendered in the Wix UI during the registration process (RSVP or checkout).
It also contains customizable messages and labels.

members.name: eventId
members.doc: Event ID to which the form belongs.

members.name: eventId
members.doc: Event ID to which the form belongs.

members.name: eventId
members.doc: Event ID to which the form belongs.

members.name: registrationClosed
members.doc: Messages shown when event registration is closed.

members.name: ticketsUnavailable
members.doc: Messages shown when event tickets are unavailable.

description:
Defines form messages shown in UI before, during, and after registration flow.
It enables configuration of form titles, response labels, "thank you" messages, and call-to-action texts.

members.name: eventId
members.doc: Event ID to which the form belongs.

members.name: draftForm
members.doc:
Draft event form.
Not available to visitors unless published.

members.name: form
members.doc:
Currently published event form.
Published form is visible to site visitors.

members.name: publicGuestList
members.doc: Whether members can see other members attending the event (defaults to true).

members.name: anonymousVisitorId
members.doc: ID of a site visitor that has not logged in to the site.

members.name: memberId
members.doc: ID of a site visitor that has logged in to the site.

members.name: wixUserId
members.doc: ID of a Wix user (site owner, contributor, etc.).

members.name: anonymousVisitorId
members.doc: ID of a site visitor that has not logged in to the site.

members.name: memberId
members.doc: ID of a site visitor that has logged in to the site.

members.name: wixUserId
members.doc: ID of a Wix user (site owner, contributor, etc.).

members.name: additionalLabels
members.doc: Additional labels for multi-valued fields such as address.

members.name: defaultOptionSelection
members.doc:
Preselected option.
Currently only applicable for dropdown.

members.name: labels
members.doc: Additional labels for multi-valued fields such as address.

members.name: maxLength
members.doc: Maximum number of accepted characters (relevant for text fields).

members.name: maxSize
members.doc:
The maximum number of accepted values for array input.
**Note:** Only applicable for `TEXT_ARRAY` input fields.

members.name: options
members.doc: Predefined choice options for fields, such as dropdown.

members.name: type
members.doc:
Type which determines field format.
Used to validate submitted response.

description: An input of one or multiple text values

members.name: orderIndex
members.doc: Field controls are sorted by this value in ascending order.

members.name: system
members.doc:
Whether the control is mandatory (such as `name` & `email`).
When `true`, only the label can be changed.

members.name: type
members.doc:
Field control type. Possible values:
- `INPUT`: Single text value field.
- `TEXTAREA`: Single text value field with multiple lines.
- `DROPDOWN`: Single-choice field with predefined values.
- `RADIO`: Single-choice field with predefined values.
- `CHECKBOX`: Multiple-choice field with predefined values.
- `NAME`: Fields for entering first and last names.
- `GUEST_CONTROL`: Fields for additional guests and their respective names.
- `ADDRESS_SHORT`: Single-line address field.
- `ADDRESS_FULL`: Full address field with multiple lines.
- `DATE`: Fields for entering year, month, and day.

description:
A block of nested fields.
Used to aggregate similar inputs like First Name and Last Name.

members.name: isMain
members.doc: Whether the keyword is the main focus keyword.

members.name: single
members.doc: Input label for a single guest.

members.name: fullAddress
members.doc:
Full address derived from formatted single line `address`.
When `full_address` is used to create or update the event, deprecated `address` and `coordinates` are ignored.
If provided `full_address` has empty `formatted_address` or `coordinates`, it will be auto-completed using Atlas service.

Migration notes:
- `full_address.formatted_address` is equivalent to `address`.
- `full_address.geocode` is equivalent to `coordinates`.

members.name: tbd
members.doc:
Defines event location as TBD (To Be Determined).
When event location is not yet defined, `name` is displayed instead of location address.
`coordinates`, `address`, `type` and `full_address` are not required when location is TBD.

members.name: identity
members.doc: The identification type and identity data.

members.name: currency
members.doc: ISO 4217 format of the currency i.e. `USD`.

members.name: value
members.doc: Monetary amount. Decimal string with a period as a decimal separator (e.g., 3.99). Optionally, a single (-), to indicate that the amount is negative.

members.name: labels
members.doc: Name control labels of each input

members.name: title
members.doc: Main form title for negative response.

description: A set of messages shown during registration with negative response

members.name: showTimeZone
members.doc: Whether time zone is displayed in formatted schedule.

members.name: timeZoneId
members.doc: Event time zone ID in TZ database format, e.g., `EST`, `America/Los_Angeles`.

members.name: enabled
members.doc:
Whether online conferencing is enabled (not supported for TBD schedules).
When enabled, links to join conferencing are generated and provided to guests.

members.name: guestLink
members.doc: Link for guests to join the online conference session.

members.name: hostLink
members.doc: Link for event host to start the online conference session.

members.name: password
members.doc: The password required to join online conferencing session (when relevant).

members.name: sessionCreated
members.doc: Indicates that session was created successfully on providers side.

members.name: optionIndex
members.doc: 0-based index from predefined `input.options` which is selected initially.

members.name: placeholderText
members.doc:
Placeholder hint describing expected choices (such as "Please select").
Considered an empty choice.

description:
Describes initially selected option when an input has multiple choices.
Defaults to first (0th) option if not configured.

members.name: optionIndex
members.doc: 0-based index from predefined `input.options` which is selected initially.

members.name: placeholderText
members.doc:
Placeholder hint describing expected choices (such as "Please select").
Considered an empty choice.

members.name: title
members.doc: Main form title for positive response.

description: Set of messages shown during registration when RSVP response is positive.

members.name: eventId
members.doc: Event ID to which the form belongs.

members.name: options
members.doc: Predefined options guests can choose from.

members.name: initialType
members.doc: Initial event type which was set when creating an event.

members.name: restrictedTo
members.doc: Types of users allowed to register.

members.name: message
members.doc: Message shown when event registration is closed.

members.name: limit
members.doc:
Total guest limit available to register to the event.
Additional guests per RSVP are counted towards total guests.

members.name: waitlist
members.doc: Whether a waitlist is opened when total guest limit is reached, allowing guests to create RSVP with WAITING RSVP status.

members.name: waitlistMessages
members.doc: Messages shown for RSVP = `WAITING` (when event is full and waitlist is available).

members.name: endDateHidden
members.doc: Whether end date is hidden in the formatted schedule.

members.name: scheduleTbd
members.doc:
Defines event as TBD (To Be Determined) schedule.
When event time is not yet defined, TBD message is displayed instead of event start and end times.
`startDate`, `endDate` and `timeZoneId` are not required when schedule is TBD.

members.name: showTimeZone
members.doc: Whether time zone is displayed in formatted schedule.

members.name: timeZoneId
members.doc: Event time zone ID in TZ database format, e.g., `EST`, `America/Los_Angeles`.

members.name: endDateFormatted
members.doc: Formatted end date of the event (empty for TBD schedules or when end date is hidden).

members.name: endTimeFormatted
members.doc: Formatted end time of the event (empty for TBD schedules or when end date is hidden).

members.name: startDateFormatted
members.doc: Formatted start date of the event (empty for TBD schedules).

members.name: startTimeFormatted
members.doc: Formatted start time of the event (empty for TBD schedules).

description:
The SEO schema object contains data about different types of meta tags. It makes sure that the information about your page is presented properly to search engines.
The search engines use this information for ranking purposes, or to display snippets in the search results.
This data will override other sources of tags (for example patterns) and will be included in the <head> section of the HTML document, while not being displayed on the page itself.

members.name: keywords
members.doc: User-selected keyword terms for a specific page.

members.name: preventAutoRedirect
members.doc:
Whether the Auto Redirect feature, which creates `301 redirects` on a slug change, is enabled.

Default: `false` (Auto Redirect is enabled.)

members.name: base
members.doc:
Base URL. For premium sites, this will be the domain.
For free sites, this would be site URL (e.g `mysite.wixsite.com/mysite`)

members.name: path
members.doc: The path to that page - e.g `/my-events/weekly-meetup-2`

members.name: children
members.doc: SEO tag inner content. For example, `<title> inner content </title>`.

members.name: custom
members.doc: Whether the tag is a custom tag.

members.name: meta
members.doc: SEO tag meta data. For example, `{height: 300, width: 240}`.

members.name: props
members.doc:
A `{'key':'value'}` pair object where each SEO tag property (`'name'`, `'content'`, `'rel'`, `'href'`) contains a value.
For example: `{'name': 'description', 'content': 'the description itself'}`.

members.name: appliesToDonations
members.doc: Applies taxes for donations, default true.

members.name: comment
members.doc: Whether input control should be displayed as a comment.

members.name: multiLine
members.doc: Whether input control should allow multiple lines in text.

members.name: highestTicketPriceFormatted
members.doc: Formatted price of highest priced ticket.

members.name: lowestTicketPriceFormatted
members.doc: Formatted price of lowest priced ticket.

members.name: soldOut
members.doc: Whether all tickets are sold for this event.

members.name: guestAssignedTickets
members.doc: Whether the form must be filled out separately for each ticket.

members.name: reservationDurationInMinutes
members.doc: Duration for which the tickets being bought are reserved.

members.name: ticketLimitPerOrder
members.doc: Limit of tickets that can be purchased per order, default 20.

members.name: currencyLocked
members.doc: Whether currency is locked and cannot be changed (generally occurs after the first order in the specified currency has been created).

members.name: revenue
members.doc:
Total revenue, excluding fees.
(taxes and payment provider fees are not deducted.)

members.name: message
members.doc: Message shown when event tickets are unavailable.

members.name: address
members.doc: Single-line or full address input control.

members.name: date
members.doc: Day, month, year date input control.

members.name: eventId
members.doc: Event ID to which the form belongs.

members.doc: Single-line or full address input control.

members.doc: Index used to sort input controls in ascending order.
